result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall I. Majors was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall I. Majors

Minutes:  14CF792/14CF1132.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

14CF792 - amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 - sentenced to 8 days KCJ.  Credit for 8 days served.  Costs rolled in.  Count 2 - fined $200 plus costs.  Bond to apply.

14CF1132 - amended information filed.  Language amended on the amended information.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Deft sentenced to 4 days KCJ.  Credit for 4 days.  Costs rolled in.  Bond to be returned to poster.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Atty Karls reports the case is not settled yet; ADA Burgoyne is assigned to this case presently in trial in this branch.  Parties are to notify the court by 5pm on 2/25/15 if the case is resolved.  No plea bargaining will be allowed after that date.  Leave on for trial for 3/2/15 @ 9am

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Val Karls. Clerk LE. Case trails 14CF1132. Judicial pretrial on 2-11-15 @ 10:00am. Jury selection on 3-2-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
case trails 14CF1132 and is rescheduled to 11-19-14 @ 9:45am at the request of Atty. Karls. DA's Office notified.

215pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Val Karls.  Clerk LE.  Referred to Intake for further dispo on 11/11/14 @ 915.  Trails 14CF1132.  Bond continued.
Hearing on November 11, 2014 at 09:15 am.

144 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney R Defilippis for V Karls.  Clk  KZ  Trails 14-CF-1132.  Bond - continued.  STC on 10/22/14 @ 1 p.m.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Karls.  Deft has new charges pending; warrant signed by the Court Comm on 9/25/14.  Bond amended in this file to $2,000 cash.  Deft taken into custody.  This file to trail the new file which has been set for an initial appearance on 9/30/14 @ 1pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Brief discussion held on the motion re: other acts.  Court w/holds a ruling at this time but the bias is towards admission of the other acts.  Offer relayed previously.  Court takes a short recess to allow the parties to confer.  Court reconvenes.  For the reasons set forth on the record, the ludwig hrg will be held prior to the trial.

FPT set for 9/10/14 @ 11am.  JT set for 9/29/14 @ 9am.  Arguments heard on deft's bond motion.  Contact between deft and complaining witness will be allowed for joint counseling ONLY.
for Bond Review filed by Atty Valerie Karls

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Val Karls. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by Atty. Karls.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3 for arraignment on 8-13-14 @ 9:00am. Information filed. Atty. Karls has filed motion for bond modification. State opposes modification. Court denies motion. Bond continued.
